textAfterTable: Event Detail Information Event Detail Information Scholarship of Sustainability Series: Spring 2013 The Cultural Contexts of Environmental Decline Date Feb 21, 2013 Time 4:00 pm - 5:30 pm   Location Room 124 Burrill Hall, 407 S. Goodwin Avenue, Urbana Sponsor Center for a Sustainable Environment with co-sponsorship from the School of Earth, Society, and the Environment; the College of Law: and the Student Sustainability Committee. Views 90 February 21.  Otherworldly Religions.  How have religious views affected our uses of nature, and how might religion today push us in good or bad directions?  We’ll consider historian Lynn White’s famous argument and responses to it and also look at how we might evaluate religions–even individual congregations—based on environmental factors. (Discussion led by Robert McKim, Professor of Religion and Philosophy UIUC) link for robots only   Center for
